intro: Cynorkis gabonensis, commonly known as the Gabon sandwort, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Montiniaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure. The plant features small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to survive in arid or semi-arid conditions. Cynorkis gabonensis is often found in rocky soils and is valued for its ornamental appeal in dry garden settings.
